1: %% This suite tests the incremental mode which for now woirks as follows:
    2: %% You can specify which files you want in your plt, incremental mode will
    3: %% do the analysis needed to get the PLT into a good state and report the
    4: %% warnings from the modules which it re-analyzed.
    5: 
    6: -module(incremental_SUITE).
    7: 
    8: -include_lib("common_test/include/ct.hrl").
    9: -include_lib("stdlib/include/assert.hrl").
   10: -include("dialyzer_test_constants.hrl").
   11: 
   12: -export([suite/0,
   13:          all/0,
   14:          report_new_plt_test/1,
   15:          report_degree_of_incrementality_test/1,
   16:          report_no_stored_warnings_test/1,
   17:          report_stored_warnings_no_files_changed_test/1,
   18:          report_stored_warnings_only_files_safely_removed_test/1,
   19:          report_old_plt_version_number_test/1,
   20:          report_old_plt_version_hash_test/1,
   21:          report_legal_warnings_added/1,
   22:          report_legal_warnings_removed/1,
   23:          incremental_test/1,
   24:          incremental_select_warnings_test/1,
   25:          add_and_remove_test/1,
   26:          add_and_remove_test_with_unknown_warnings/1,
   27:          verify_plt_info/1,
   28:          verify_plt_info_with_unknown_warnings/1,
   29:          fixing_all_warnings/1,
   30:          default_apps_config_xdg/1,
   31:          default_apps_config_env_var/1,
   32:          default_apps_config_env_var_prioritised_over_xdg/1,
   33:          legal_warnings_config_xdg/1,
   34:          paths_config_xdg/1,
   35:          multiple_plts_unsupported_in_incremental_mode/1]).
   36: 
   37: suite() ->
   38:   [{timetrap, ?plt_timeout}].
   39: 
   40: all() -> [report_new_plt_test,
   41:           report_degree_of_incrementality_test,
   42:           report_no_stored_warnings_test,
   43:           report_stored_warnings_no_files_changed_test,
   44:           report_stored_warnings_only_files_safely_removed_test,
   45:           report_old_plt_version_number_test,
   46:           report_old_plt_version_hash_test,
   47:           report_legal_warnings_added,
   48:           report_legal_warnings_removed,
   49:           incremental_test,
   50:           incremental_select_warnings_test,
   51:           add_and_remove_test,
   52:           add_and_remove_test_with_unknown_warnings,
   53:           verify_plt_info,
   54:           verify_plt_info_with_unknown_warnings,
   55:           fixing_all_warnings,
   56:           default_apps_config_xdg,
   57:           default_apps_config_env_var,
   58:           default_apps_config_env_var_prioritised_over_xdg,
   59:           legal_warnings_config_xdg,
   60:           paths_config_xdg,
   61:           multiple_plts_unsupported_in_incremental_mode].
   62: 
   63: erlang_module() ->
   64:    case code:where_is_file("erlang.beam") of
   65:        non_existing ->
   66:            filename:join([code:root_dir(),
   67:                          "erts", "preloaded", "ebin",
   68:                          "erlang.beam"]);
   69:       EBeam ->
   70:           EBeam
   71:    end.
   72: 
   73: verify_plt_info_with_unknown_warnings(Config) ->
   74:     PrivDir = ?config(priv_dir, Config),
   75:     DataDir =  ?config(data_dir, Config),
   76:     ToPath = fun(Modules) -> [PrivDir ++ atom_to_list(Module) ++ ".beam" ||
   77:                                  Module <- Modules] end,
   78:     Plt = filename:join(PrivDir, "verify_plt_info.iplt"),
   79:     compile_all(DataDir, PrivDir),
   80:     ErlangModule = erlang_module(),
   81:     Opts = [{init_plt, [Plt]}, {warnings, [unknown]}],
   82:     AllSubSets = all_subsets(all_mods()),
   83:     Run = fun(Mods) -> run_dialyzer(incremental, [ErlangModule | ToPath(Mods)], Opts) end,
   84:     [run_and_verify_plt_info_with_unknown_warnings(Subset, Run, Plt) ||
   85:         Subset <- AllSubSets].
   86: 
   87: run_and_verify_plt_info_with_unknown_warnings(Subset, Run, PltFile) ->
   88:     _ = Run(Subset),
   89:     {Plt, {iplt_info, _Md5, _ModDeps, Warnings, _LegalWarnings}} =
   90:         dialyzer_iplt:plt_and_info_from_file(PltFile),
   91:     dialyzer_plt:delete(Plt),
   92:     verify_unknown_warnings(Subset, Warnings).
   93: 
   94: verify_unknown_warnings(Subset, Warnings) ->
   95:     Unused = all_mods() -- Subset,
   96:     lists:foreach(fun(Mod) -> check_unknown_warnings(Mod, Unused, Warnings) end, Subset),
   97:     lists:foreach(fun(Mod) -> check_unused_mod_warnings(Mod, Warnings) end, Unused).
   98: 
   99: check_unknown_warnings(Mod, Unused, Warnings) ->
  100:     Unknown = [unknown_function_warning(M) ||
  101:                   M <- Unused, lists:member(Mod, depends_on(M))],
  102:     Other = [warning_for_module(Mod)],
  103:     Expected = lists:sort(Unknown ++ Other),
  104:     Stored = lists:sort(replace_location(maps:get(Mod, Warnings))),
  105:     Expected = Stored.
  106: 
  107: unknown_function_warning(M) ->
  108:     {warn_unknown, loc, {unknown_function, {M, id, 1}}}.
  109: 
  110: verify_plt_info(Config) ->
  111:     PrivDir = ?config(priv_dir, Config),
  112:     DataDir =  ?config(data_dir, Config),
  113:     ToPath = fun(Modules) -> [PrivDir ++ atom_to_list(Module) ++ ".beam" ||
  114:                                  Module <- Modules] end,
  115:     Plt = filename:join(PrivDir, "verify_plt_info.iplt"),
  116:     compile_all(DataDir, PrivDir),
  117:     ErlangModule = erlang_module(),
  118:     Opts = [{init_plt, [Plt]}],
  119:     AllSubSets = all_subsets(all_mods()),
  120:     Run = fun(Mods) -> run_dialyzer(incremental, [ErlangModule | ToPath(Mods)], Opts) end,
  121:     [run_and_verify_plt_info(Subset, Run, Plt) || Subset <- AllSubSets].
  122: 
  123: run_and_verify_plt_info(Subset, Run, PltFile) ->
  124:     _ = Run(Subset),
  125:     {Plt, {iplt_info, Md5, ModDeps, Warnings, _LegalWarnings}} =
  126:         dialyzer_iplt:plt_and_info_from_file(PltFile),
  127:     dialyzer_plt:delete(Plt),
  128:     verify_md5_list([erlang|Subset], Md5),
  129:     verify_mod_deps(Subset, ModDeps),
  130:     verify_warnings(Subset, Warnings).
  131: 
  132: verify_md5_list(AllModules, Md5) ->
  133:     ExpectedModules = lists:sort(AllModules),
  134:     ActualModules = lists:sort([ModuleName || {ModuleName, _CheckSum} <- Md5]),
  135:     case ExpectedModules =:= ActualModules of
  136:         true ->
  137:             ok;
  138:         false ->
  139:             ct:pal("Expected modules: ~p~nActual Modules:~p~n",
  140:                    [ExpectedModules, ActualModules]),
  141:             ExpectedModules = ActualModules
  142:     end.
  143: 
  144: verify_mod_deps(Subset, ModDeps) ->
  145:     Unused = all_mods() -- Subset,
  146:     DependsOn = fun(Mod) -> depends_on(Mod) -- Unused end,
  147:     lists:foreach(fun(Mod) -> check_one_mod(Mod, ModDeps, DependsOn) end, Subset).
  148: 
  149: check_one_mod(Mod, ModDeps, DependsOn) ->
  150:     StoredDeps = lists:sort(rewrite_ans(dict:find(Mod, ModDeps))),
  151:     ExpectedDeps = lists:sort(DependsOn(Mod)),
  152:     case ExpectedDeps =:= StoredDeps of
  153:         true ->
  154:             ok;
  155:         false ->
  156:             ct:pal("Expected deps: ~p~nStored deps:~p~n",
  157:                         [ExpectedDeps, StoredDeps]),
  158:             ExpectedDeps = StoredDeps
  159:     end.
  160: 
  161: rewrite_ans({ok, Value}) -> Value;
  162: rewrite_ans(error) -> [].
  163: 
  164: verify_warnings(Subset, Warnings) ->
  165:     Unused = all_mods() -- Subset,
  166:     lists:foreach(fun(Mod) -> check_warnings(Mod, Warnings) end, Subset),
  167:     lists:foreach(fun(Mod) -> check_unused_mod_warnings(Mod, Warnings) end, Unused).
  168: 
  169: check_warnings(Mod, Warnings) ->
  170:     StoredWarnings = lists:sort(replace_location(maps:get(Mod, Warnings))),
  171:     ExpectedWarnings = [warning_for_module(Mod)],
  172:     ExpectedWarnings = StoredWarnings.
  173: 
  174: check_unused_mod_warnings(Mod, Warnings) ->
  175:     false = maps:is_key(Mod, Warnings).
  176: 
  177: add_and_remove_test_with_unknown_warnings(Config) ->
  178:     PrivDir = ?config(priv_dir, Config),
  179:     DataDir =  ?config(data_dir, Config),
  180:     ToPath = fun(Modules) -> [PrivDir ++ atom_to_list(Module) ++ ".beam" ||
  181:                                  Module <- Modules] end,
  182:     Plt = filename:join(PrivDir, "add_and_remove.iplt"),
  183:     compile_all(DataDir, PrivDir),
  184:     Opts = [{init_plt, [Plt]}, {warnings, [unknown]}, {report_mode, verbose}],
  185:     Run = fun(Mods) ->
  186:             run_dialyzer_for_modules_analyzed(incremental,
  187:                          [erlang_module() | ToPath(Mods)],
  188:                          [{warning_files, ToPath(Mods)} | Opts])
  189:           end,
  190:     %% We ignore empty Mods, since no warning modules modules is
  191:     %% interpreted as a request to show all warning modules (for
  192:     %% convenience). However, if all module warnings are shown and
  193:     %% 'unknown' warnings are enabled, we get a load of 'unknown'
  194:     %% warnings from the built-in Erlang module, so we exclude that
  195:     %% case here
  196:     AllSubSets = [Mods || Mods <- all_subsets(all_mods()), Mods =/= []],
  197:     %Pairs = [{I, N} || I <- AllSubSets, N <- AllSubSets], % All pairs takes ~ 10 mins to run
  198:     Pairs = some_pairs(AllSubSets),
  199:     [run_one_add_and_remove_test(Initial, New, Run, true) || {Initial, New} <- Pairs],
  200:     ok.
  201: 
  202: %% Run the tests to add and remove modules for some combinations
  203: add_and_remove_test(Config) ->
  204:     PrivDir = ?config(priv_dir, Config),
  205:     DataDir =  ?config(data_dir, Config),
  206:     ToPath = fun(Modules) -> [PrivDir ++ atom_to_list(Module) ++ ".beam" || Module <- Modules] end,
  207:     Plt = filename:join(PrivDir, "add_and_remove.iplt"),
  208:     compile_all(DataDir, PrivDir),
  209:     Opts = [{init_plt, [Plt]}, {report_mode, verbose}, {warnings, [no_unknown]}],
  210:     Run = fun(Mods) -> run_dialyzer_for_modules_analyzed(incremental, [erlang_module() | ToPath(Mods)], Opts) end,
  211:     AllSubSets = [Mods || Mods <- all_subsets(all_mods())],
  212:     %Pairs = [{I, N} || I <- AllSubSets, N <- AllSubSets], % All pairs takes ~ 10 mins to run
  213:     Pairs = some_pairs(AllSubSets),
  214:     [run_one_add_and_remove_test(Initial, New, Run, false) || {Initial, New} <- Pairs],
  215:     ok.
  216: 
  217: 
  218: %% Runs a test where we first run the analysis on the InitialSet, and
  219: %% then run the analysis on the newset, checking that we get the
  220: %% warnings we expect given this change of modules. Supports running
  221: %% with unknown function and types and also with getting warnings for
  222: %% all modules, not just the re-analyzed ones.
  223: run_one_add_and_remove_test(InitialSet, NewSet, Run, WithUnknown) ->
  224:     {ExpectedErrors, ExpectedAnalyzed} =
  225:         expected_warnings_and_analyzed_add_and_remove(InitialSet, NewSet, WithUnknown),
  226:     _ = Run(InitialSet),
  227:     {ErrorsRaw, Analyzed} = Run(NewSet),
  228:     Errors = ordsets:from_list(replace_location(ErrorsRaw)),
  229: 
  230:     if Errors =/= ExpectedErrors ->
  231:             ct:pal("Initial modules: ~p~nNew Modules:~p~nModules analyzed:~p~nModules expected to be analyzed:~p~n"
  232:                    "Returned Warnings:~p~nExpected Warnings:~p~n",
  233:                    [InitialSet, NewSet, Analyzed, ExpectedAnalyzed, Errors, ExpectedErrors]),
  234:             {Errors, Analyzed} = {ExpectedErrors, ExpectedAnalyzed};
  235:         true ->
  236:             ok
  237:     end.
  238: 
  239: %% Just create some pairs.
  240: some_pairs([A, B | Rest]) ->
  241:     [{A, B} | some_pairs([B|Rest])];
  242: some_pairs(_) -> [].
  243: 
  244: 
  245: %% We expect incrementality to minimise the number of modules
  246: %% re-analysed, but still report warnings for modules which didn't
  247: %% need to be re-analysed because their warnings were cached.  We
  248: %% expect a module to be re-analyzed when it is freshly added or when
  249: %% one of its transistive dependencies have been added or removed,
  250: %% using the dependency graph from the previous run.  Adds unknown
  251: %% function warnings when they are supported, and generates all
  252: %% warnings when that feature is turned on.
  253: expected_warnings_and_analyzed_add_and_remove(Initial, New, WithUnknown) ->
  254:     InitialSet = ordsets:from_list(Initial),
  255:     NewSet = ordsets:from_list(New),
  256:     Removed = ordsets:from_list(InitialSet -- NewSet),
  257:     Added = ordsets:from_list(NewSet -- InitialSet),
  258:     Changed = ordsets:union(Removed, Added),
  259:     All = ordsets:from_list(all_mods()),
  260:     Missing = ordsets:subtract(All, NewSet),
  261:     DependsOn = fun(Mod) -> depends_on(Mod, fun(X) -> lists:member(X, InitialSet) end) end,
  262:     Dependencies = ordsets:from_list([Mod || C <- Changed, Mod <- depends_on_transitively(C, DependsOn)]),
  263:     Analyzed = ordsets:intersection(ordsets:union(Added, Dependencies), NewSet),
  264:     WarnModules = NewSet,
  265:     UnknownWarnings =
  266:         [unknown_function_warning(M) ||
  267:             WithUnknown,
  268:             Mod <- WarnModules,
  269:             M <- Missing,
  270:             lists:member(Mod, depends_on(M))],
  271:     {ordsets:from_list([warning_for_module(Mod) ||
  272:                            Mod <- WarnModules] ++ UnknownWarnings), Analyzed}.
  273: 
  274: %% Run the incremental test for all combination of the 6 modules,
  275: %% checking that we get the expected level of incrementality, i.e. we
  276: %% only reanalyze what we need to given what has changed
  277: incremental_test(Config) ->
  278:     PrivDir = ?config(priv_dir, Config),
  279:     DataDir =  ?config(data_dir, Config),
  280:     ToPath = fun(Modules) -> [PrivDir ++ atom_to_list(Module) ++ ".beam" ||
  281:                                  Module <- Modules] end,
  282:     Change = fun(M) -> change_module(DataDir, PrivDir, M) end,
  283:     Plt = filename:join(PrivDir, "incremental.iplt"),
  284:     compile_all(DataDir, PrivDir),
  285:     Opts = [{init_plt, [Plt]}, {report_mode, verbose}, {warnings, [no_unknown]}],
  286:     AllWarnings = run_dialyzer(incremental, [erlang_module() | ToPath(all_mods())], Opts),
  287:     Run = fun() ->
  288:                   run_dialyzer_for_modules_analyzed(incremental,
  289:                                                     [erlang_module() | ToPath(all_mods())],
  290:                                                     Opts)
  291:           end,
  292:     [run_one_incremental_test(SubSet, Change, Run, AllWarnings) ||
  293:         SubSet <- lists:reverse(all_subsets(all_mods()))],
  294:     ok.
  295: 
  296: %% Run the incremental test for all combination of the 6 modules,
  297: %% checking that with or without touching a file, we get the expected
  298: %% warnings
  299: incremental_select_warnings_test(Config) ->
  300:     PrivDir = ?config(priv_dir, Config),
  301:     DataDir =  ?config(data_dir, Config),
  302:     ToPath = fun(Modules) -> [PrivDir ++ atom_to_list(Module) ++ ".beam" ||
  303:                                  Module <- Modules] end,
  304:     Plt = filename:join(PrivDir, "select_warnings.iplt"),
  305:     compile_all(DataDir, PrivDir),
  306:     Opts = [{init_plt, [Plt]}],
  307:     _ = run_dialyzer(incremental, [erlang_module() | ToPath(all_mods())], Opts),
  308:     RunWithoutChange =
  309:         fun(ExtraOpt) ->
  310:             run_dialyzer(incremental, [erlang_module() | ToPath(all_mods())], [ExtraOpt|Opts])
  311:         end,
  312:     RunWithChange =
  313:         fun(ExtraOpt) ->
  314:              change_module(DataDir, PrivDir, m4),
  315:              run_dialyzer(incremental, [erlang_module() | ToPath(all_mods())], [ExtraOpt|Opts])
  316:         end,
  317:     TestSets = [Mods || Mods <- all_subsets(all_mods()), Mods =/= []],
  318:     [run_one_select_warnings_test(SubSet, RunWithoutChange, ToPath) || SubSet <- TestSets],
  319:     [run_one_select_warnings_test(SubSet, RunWithChange, ToPath) || SubSet <- TestSets].
  320: 
  321: run_one_select_warnings_test(WarningMods, Run, ToPath) ->
  322:     ExpectedWarnings = lists:sort([warning_for_module(M) || M <- WarningMods]),
  323:     ActualWarnings = lists:sort(replace_location(Run({warning_files, ToPath(WarningMods)}))),
  324:     case ExpectedWarnings =/= ActualWarnings of
  325:         true ->
  326:             ct:pal("Warning modules: ~p~nReturned Warnings:~p~nExpected Warnings:~p~n",
  327:                    [WarningMods, ActualWarnings, ExpectedWarnings]),
  328:             ExpectedWarnings = ActualWarnings;
  329:         false ->
  330:             ok
  331:     end.
  332: 
  333: %% Recompiles a set of modules and then runs the analysis verifying that we re-analyze
  334: %% the changed modules and their transitive dependencies.
  335: run_one_incremental_test(ChangedMods, Change, Run, ExpectedWarnings) ->
  336:     lists:foreach(Change, ChangedMods),
  337:     ExpectedModulesAnalyzed = expected_modules_reanalyzed_incremental(ChangedMods),
  338:     {Warnings, ModulesAnalyzed} = Run(),
  339:     if Warnings =/= ExpectedWarnings ->
  340:             ct:pal("Changed modules: ~p~nModules reanalyzed:~p~nExpected modules reanalyzed:~p~nReturned Warnings:~p~nExpected Warnings:~p~n",
  341:                    [ChangedMods, ModulesAnalyzed, ExpectedModulesAnalyzed, Warnings, ExpectedWarnings]),
  342:             {Warnings, ModulesAnalyzed} = {ExpectedWarnings, ExpectedModulesAnalyzed};
  343:         true ->
  344:             ok
  345:     end.
  346: 
  347: check_metrics_file_contents(MetricsFileName, ExpectedMetricsFileStr) ->
  348:     {ok, MetricsFileBin} = file:read_file(MetricsFileName),
  349:     MetricsFileStr = unicode:characters_to_list(MetricsFileBin),
  350:     if MetricsFileStr =/= ExpectedMetricsFileStr ->
  351:         ct:pal("Metrics file didn't contain expected contents. Expected:~n~p~nActual:~n~p~n",
  352:                 [ExpectedMetricsFileStr, MetricsFileStr]),
  353:         ExpectedMetricsFileStr = MetricsFileStr;
  354:       true ->
  355:         ok
  356:     end.
  357: 
  358: report_new_plt_test(Config) ->
  359:     PrivDir = ?config(priv_dir, Config),
  360:     DataDir =  ?config(data_dir, Config),
  361:     MetricsFile = PrivDir ++ "my_incrementality_metrics.log",
  362:     ToPath = fun(Modules) -> [PrivDir ++ atom_to_list(Module) ++ ".beam" || Module <- Modules] end,
  363:     Plt = filename:join(PrivDir, atom_to_list(?FUNCTION_NAME) ++ ".iplt"),
  364:     compile_all(DataDir, PrivDir),
  365:     Opts = [{init_plt, [Plt]}, {report_mode, verbose}, {metrics_file, MetricsFile}],
  366:     {_Warnings, Stdout} = run_dialyzer_capture(incremental, [erlang_module() | ToPath(all_mods())], Opts),
  367:     CandidateLines =
  368:         lists:filter(
  369:           fun (Line) ->
  370:             case string:prefix(Line, "PLT does not yet exist at") of
  371:                 nomatch -> false;
  372:                 _ -> true
  373:             end
  374:           end,
  375:           Stdout),
  376:     ExpectedLine = "PLT does not yet exist at " ++ Plt ++ ", so an analysis must be run for 7 modules to populate it\n",
  377:     if CandidateLines =/= [ExpectedLine] ->
  378:         ct:pal("Failed to find expected log line in stdout.~nExpected:~n  ~p~nLines that look close:  ~n~p~n",
  379:                 [ExpectedLine, CandidateLines]),
  380:         CandidateLines = [ExpectedLine];
  381:       true ->
  382:         ok
  383:     end,
  384:     ExpectedMetricsFileStr =
  385:         "total_modules: 7\n"
  386:         "analysed_modules: 7\n"
  387:         "reason: new_plt_file\n",
  388:     check_metrics_file_contents(MetricsFile, ExpectedMetricsFileStr).
  389: 
  390: report_degree_of_incrementality_test(Config) ->
  391:     PrivDir = ?config(priv_dir, Config),
  392:     DataDir =  ?config(data_dir, Config),
  393:     MetricsFile = PrivDir ++ "my_incrementality_metrics.log",
  394:     ToPath = fun(Modules) -> [PrivDir ++ atom_to_list(Module) ++ ".beam" || Module <- Modules] end,
  395:     Plt = filename:join(PrivDir, atom_to_list(?FUNCTION_NAME) ++ ".iplt"),
  396:     compile_all(DataDir, PrivDir),
  397:     Opts = [{init_plt, [Plt]}, {report_mode, verbose}, {metrics_file, MetricsFile}],
  398:     _WarningsBeforeTouchingFile = run_dialyzer(incremental, [erlang_module() | ToPath(all_mods())], Opts),
  399:     change_module(DataDir, PrivDir, m1),
  400:     change_module(DataDir, PrivDir, m5),
  401:     {_WarningsAfterTouchingFile, Stdout} = run_dialyzer_capture(incremental, [erlang_module() | ToPath(all_mods())], Opts),
  402: 
  403:     ExpectedLine =
  404:         "    Of the 7 files being tracked, 2 have been changed or removed, "
  405:         "resulting in 5 requiring analysis because they depend on those changes\n",
  406:     case lists:any(fun (Line) -> Line =:= ExpectedLine end, Stdout) of
  407:       false ->
  408:         ct:pal("Failed to find expected log line in stdout.~nExpected:~n  ~p~nStdout:  ~n~p~n",
  409:                 [ExpectedLine, Stdout]),
  410:         ct:fail("Dialyzer failed to print the expected line to stdout");
  411:       true ->
  412:         ok
  413:     end,
  414:     ExpectedMetricsFileStr =
  415:         "total_modules: 7\n"
  416:         "analysed_modules: 5\n"
  417:         "reason: incremental_changes\n"
  418:         "changed_or_removed_modules: 2\n",
  419:     check_metrics_file_contents(MetricsFile, ExpectedMetricsFileStr).
  420: 
  421: report_stored_warnings_only_files_safely_removed_test(Config) ->
  422:     PrivDir = ?config(priv_dir, Config),
  423:     DataDir =  ?config(data_dir, Config),
  424:     MetricsFile = PrivDir ++ "my_incrementality_metrics.log",
  425:     ToPath = fun(Modules) -> [PrivDir ++ atom_to_list(Module) ++ ".beam" || Module <- Modules] end,
  426:     Plt = filename:join(PrivDir, atom_to_list(?FUNCTION_NAME) ++ ".iplt"),
  427:     compile_all(DataDir, PrivDir),
  428:     Opts = [{init_plt, [Plt]}, {report_mode, verbose}, {metrics_file, MetricsFile}],
  429:     _WarningsBeforeTouchingFile = run_dialyzer(incremental, [erlang_module() | ToPath(all_mods())], Opts),
  430:     delete_module_beam_file(PrivDir, m1),
  431:     {_WarningsAfterTouchingFile, Stdout} = run_dialyzer_capture(incremental, [erlang_module() | ToPath(all_mods() -- [m1])], Opts),
  432: 
  433:     ExpectedLine =
  434:         "PLT has fully cached the request because nothing depended on the file removed, so no additional analysis is needed\n",
  435:     case lists:any(fun (Line) -> Line =:= ExpectedLine end, Stdout) of
  436:       false ->
  437:         ct:pal("Failed to find expected log line in stdout.~nExpected:~n  ~p~nStdout:  ~n~p~n",
  438:                 [ExpectedLine, Stdout]),
  439:         ct:fail("Dialyzer failed to print the expected line to stdout");
  440:       true ->
  441:         ok
  442:     end,
  443:     ExpectedMetricsFileStr =
  444:         "total_modules: 6\n"
  445:         "analysed_modules: 0\n"
  446:         "reason: incremental_changes\n"
  447:         "changed_or_removed_modules: 1\n",
  448:     check_metrics_file_contents(MetricsFile, ExpectedMetricsFileStr).
  449: 
  450: report_stored_warnings_no_files_changed_test(Config) ->
  451:     PrivDir = ?config(priv_dir, Config),
  452:     DataDir =  ?config(data_dir, Config),
  453:     MetricsFile = PrivDir ++ "my_incrementality_metrics.log",
  454:     ToPath = fun(Modules) -> [PrivDir ++ atom_to_list(Module) ++ ".beam" || Module <- Modules] end,
  455:     Plt = filename:join(PrivDir, atom_to_list(?FUNCTION_NAME) ++ ".iplt"),
  456:     compile_all(DataDir, PrivDir),
  457:     Opts = [{init_plt, [Plt]}, {report_mode, verbose}, {metrics_file, MetricsFile}],
  458:     _WarningsBeforeTouchingFile = run_dialyzer(incremental, [erlang_module() | ToPath(all_mods())], Opts),
  459:     {_WarningsAfterTouchingFile, Stdout} = run_dialyzer_capture(incremental, [erlang_module() | ToPath(all_mods())], Opts),
  460: 
  461:     ExpectedLine =
  462:         "PLT has fully cached the request, so no additional analysis is needed\n",
  463:     case lists:any(fun (Line) -> Line =:= ExpectedLine end, Stdout) of
  464:       false ->
  465:         ct:pal("Failed to find expected log line in stdout.~nExpected:~n  ~p~nStdout:  ~n~p~n",
  466:                 [ExpectedLine, Stdout]),
  467:         ct:fail("Dialyzer failed to print the expected line to stdout");
  468:       true ->
  469:         ok
  470:     end,
  471:     ExpectedMetricsFileStr =
  472:         "total_modules: 7\n"
  473:         "analysed_modules: 0\n"
  474:         "reason: incremental_changes\n"
  475:         "changed_or_removed_modules: 0\n",
  476:     check_metrics_file_contents(MetricsFile, ExpectedMetricsFileStr).
  477: 
  478: report_old_plt_version_number_test(Config) ->
  479:     PrivDir = ?config(priv_dir, Config),
  480:     DataDir =  ?config(data_dir, Config),
  481:     MetricsFile = PrivDir ++ "my_incrementality_metrics.log",
  482:     ToPath = fun(Modules) -> [PrivDir ++ atom_to_list(Module) ++ ".beam" || Module <- Modules] end,
  483:     PltFileName = filename:join(PrivDir, atom_to_list(?FUNCTION_NAME) ++ ".iplt"),
  484:     compile_all(DataDir, PrivDir),
  485:     Opts = [{init_plt, [PltFileName]}, {report_mode, verbose}, {metrics_file, MetricsFile}],
  486: 
  487:     % Set up "old" PLT file
  488:     Plt = dialyzer_plt:new(),
  489:     ModDeps = dict:new(),
  490:     ValidButEmptyPltInfo =
  491:       {iplt_info, [], dict:new(), #{}, ordsets:new()},
  492:     OldVsn = "0.0.1",
  493:     dialyzer_iplt:to_file_custom_vsn(PltFileName, Plt, ModDeps, ValidButEmptyPltInfo, OldVsn, none),
  494: 
  495:     {_WarningsAfterTouchingFile, Stdout} = run_dialyzer_capture(incremental, [erlang_module() | ToPath(all_mods())], Opts),
  496:     ExpectedLine =
  497:         "PLT is for a different Dialyzer version, so an analysis must be run for 7 modules to rebuild it\n",
  498:     case lists:any(fun (Line) -> Line =:= ExpectedLine end, Stdout) of
  499:       false ->
  500:         ct:pal("Failed to find expected log line in stdout.~nExpected:~n  ~p~nStdout:  ~n~p~n",
  501:                 [ExpectedLine, Stdout]),
  502:         ct:fail("Dialyzer failed to print the expected line to stdout");
  503:       true ->
  504:         ok
  505:     end,
  506:     ExpectedMetricsFileStr =
  507:         "total_modules: 7\n"
  508:         "analysed_modules: 7\n"
  509:         "reason: plt_built_with_different_version\n",
  510:     check_metrics_file_contents(MetricsFile, ExpectedMetricsFileStr).
  511: 
  512: report_old_plt_version_hash_test(Config) ->
  513:     PrivDir = ?config(priv_dir, Config),
  514:     DataDir =  ?config(data_dir, Config),
  515:     MetricsFile = PrivDir ++ "my_incrementality_metrics.log",
  516:     ToPath = fun(Modules) -> [PrivDir ++ atom_to_list(Module) ++ ".beam" || Module <- Modules] end,
  517:     PltFileName = filename:join(PrivDir, atom_to_list(?FUNCTION_NAME) ++ ".iplt"),
  518:     compile_all(DataDir, PrivDir),
  519:     Opts = [{init_plt, [PltFileName]}, {report_mode, verbose}, {metrics_file, MetricsFile}],
  520: 
  521:     %% Set up "old" PLT file
  522:     Plt = dialyzer_plt:new(),
  523:     ModDeps = dict:new(),
  524:     ValidButEmptyPltInfo =
  525:       {iplt_info, [], dict:new(), #{}, ordsets:new()},
  526:     FakeImplMd5 = [
  527:         {erl_types, erlang:md5([$f, $o, $o])},
  528:         {erl_bif_types, erlang:md5([$b, $a, $r])}
  529:     ],
  530:     dialyzer_iplt:to_file_custom_vsn(PltFileName, Plt, ModDeps, ValidButEmptyPltInfo, none, FakeImplMd5),
  531: 
  532:     {_WarningsAfterTouchingFile, Stdout} = run_dialyzer_capture(incremental, [erlang_module() | ToPath(all_mods())], Opts),
  533:     ExpectedLine =
  534:         "PLT is for a different Dialyzer version, so an analysis must be run for 7 modules to rebuild it\n",
  535:     case lists:any(fun (Line) -> Line =:= ExpectedLine end, Stdout) of
  536:       false ->
  537:         ct:pal("Failed to find expected log line in stdout.~nExpected:~n  ~p~nStdout:  ~n~p~n",
  538:                 [ExpectedLine, Stdout]),
  539:         ct:fail("Dialyzer failed to print the expected line to stdout");
  540:       true ->
  541:         ok
  542:     end,
  543:     ExpectedMetricsFileStr =
  544:         "total_modules: 7\n"
  545:         "analysed_modules: 7\n"
  546:         "reason: plt_built_with_different_version\n",
  547:     check_metrics_file_contents(MetricsFile, ExpectedMetricsFileStr).
  548: 
  549: report_no_stored_warnings_test(Config) ->
  550:     PrivDir = ?config(priv_dir, Config),
  551:     DataDir =  ?config(data_dir, Config),
  552:     MetricsFile = PrivDir ++ "my_incrementality_metrics.log",
  553:     ToPath = fun(Modules) -> [PrivDir ++ atom_to_list(Module) ++ ".beam" || Module <- Modules] end,
  554:     PltFileName = filename:join(PrivDir, atom_to_list(?FUNCTION_NAME) ++ ".iplt"),
  555:     compile_all(DataDir, PrivDir),
  556:     Opts = [{init_plt, [PltFileName]}, {report_mode, verbose}, {metrics_file, MetricsFile}],
  557: 
  558:     % Run Dialyzer, read the PLT, blank the warning map, then write it back
  559:     _ = run_dialyzer(incremental, [erlang_module() | ToPath(all_mods())], Opts),
  560:     {Plt, PltInfo} = dialyzer_iplt:plt_and_info_from_file(PltFileName),
  561:     {iplt_info, Md5, ModDeps, _Warnings, LegalWarnings} = PltInfo,
  562:     MissingWarningMap = none,
  563:     ValidPltInfoWithNoWarningMap =
  564:       {iplt_info, Md5, ModDeps, MissingWarningMap, LegalWarnings},
  565:     dialyzer_iplt:to_file(PltFileName, Plt, ModDeps, ValidPltInfoWithNoWarningMap),
  566: 
  567:     {_, Stdout} = run_dialyzer_capture(incremental, [erlang_module() | ToPath(all_mods())], Opts),
  568:     ExpectedLine =
  569:         "PLT does not contain cached warnings, so an analysis must be run for 7 modules to rebuild it\n",
  570:     case lists:any(fun (Line) -> Line =:= ExpectedLine end, Stdout) of
  571:       false ->
  572:         ct:pal("Failed to find expected log line in stdout.~nExpected:~n  ~p~nStdout:  ~n~p~n",
  573:                 [ExpectedLine, Stdout]),
  574:         ct:fail("Dialyzer failed to print the expected line to stdout");
  575:       true ->
  576:         ok
  577:     end,
  578:     ExpectedMetricsFileStr =
  579:         "total_modules: 7\n"
  580:         "analysed_modules: 7\n"
  581:         "reason: no_stored_warnings_in_plt\n",
  582:     check_metrics_file_contents(MetricsFile, ExpectedMetricsFileStr).
  583: 
  584: report_legal_warnings_added(Config) ->
  585:     PrivDir = ?config(priv_dir, Config),
  586:     DataDir =  ?config(data_dir, Config),
  587:     MetricsFile = PrivDir ++ "my_incrementality_metrics.log",
  588:     ToPath = fun(Modules) -> [PrivDir ++ atom_to_list(Module) ++ ".beam" || Module <- Modules] end,
  589:     Plt = filename:join(PrivDir, atom_to_list(?FUNCTION_NAME) ++ ".iplt"),
  590:     compile_all(DataDir, PrivDir),
  591:     Opts = [{init_plt, [Plt]}, {report_mode, verbose}, {warnings, [no_unknown]}],
  592:     _WarningsBeforeTouchingFile = run_dialyzer(incremental, [erlang_module() | ToPath(all_mods())], Opts),
  593:     Opts1 = [{init_plt, [Plt]}, {report_mode, verbose}, {warnings, [unknown]}, {metrics_file, MetricsFile}],
  594:     {_WarningsAfterTouchingFile, Stdout} = run_dialyzer_capture(incremental, [erlang_module() | ToPath(all_mods())], Opts1),
  595: 
  596:     ExpectedLine =
  597:         "PLT was built for a different set of enabled warnings, so an analysis "
  598:         "must be run for 7 modules to rebuild it\n",
  599:     case lists:any(fun (Line) -> Line =:= ExpectedLine end, Stdout) of
  600:       false ->
  601:         ct:pal("Failed to find expected log line in stdout.~nExpected:~n  ~p~nStdout:  ~n~p~n",
  602:                 [ExpectedLine, Stdout]),
  603:         ct:fail("Dialyzer failed to print the expected line to stdout");
  604:       true ->
  605:         ok
  606:     end,
  607:     ExpectedMetricsFileStr =
  608:         "total_modules: 7\n"
  609:         "analysed_modules: 7\n"
  610:         "reason: warnings_changed\n",
  611:     check_metrics_file_contents(MetricsFile, ExpectedMetricsFileStr).
  612: 
  613: report_legal_warnings_removed(Config) ->
  614:     PrivDir = ?config(priv_dir, Config),
  615:     DataDir =  ?config(data_dir, Config),
  616:     MetricsFile = PrivDir ++ "my_incrementality_metrics.log",
  617:     ToPath = fun(Modules) -> [PrivDir ++ atom_to_list(Module) ++ ".beam" || Module <- Modules] end,
  618:     Plt = filename:join(PrivDir, atom_to_list(?FUNCTION_NAME) ++ ".iplt"),
  619:     compile_all(DataDir, PrivDir),
  620:     Opts = [{init_plt, [Plt]}, {report_mode, verbose}, {warnings, [unknown]}],
  621:     _ = run_dialyzer(incremental, [erlang_module() | ToPath(all_mods())], Opts),
  622:     Opts1 = [{init_plt, [Plt]}, {report_mode, verbose}, {metrics_file, MetricsFile}, {warnings, [no_unknown]}],
  623:     {_, Stdout} = run_dialyzer_capture(incremental, [erlang_module() | ToPath(all_mods())], Opts1),
  624: 
  625:     ExpectedLine =
  626:         "PLT was built for a different set of enabled warnings, so an analysis "
  627:         "must be run for 7 modules to rebuild it\n",
  628:     case lists:any(fun (Line) -> Line =:= ExpectedLine end, Stdout) of
  629:       false ->
  630:         ct:pal("Failed to find expected log line in stdout.~nExpected:~n  ~p~nStdout:  ~n~p~n",
  631:                 [ExpectedLine, Stdout]),
  632:         ct:fail("Dialyzer failed to print the expected line to stdout");
  633:       true ->
  634:         ok
  635:     end,
  636:     ExpectedMetricsFileStr =
  637:         "total_modules: 7\n"
  638:         "analysed_modules: 7\n"
  639:         "reason: warnings_changed\n",
  640:     check_metrics_file_contents(MetricsFile, ExpectedMetricsFileStr).
  641: 
  642: fixing_all_warnings(Config) ->
  643:     PrivDir = ?config(priv_dir, Config),
  644:     DataDir =  ?config(data_dir, Config),
  645:     ToPath = fun(Modules) -> [PrivDir ++ atom_to_list(Module) ++ ".beam" || Module <- Modules] end,
  646:     Plt = filename:join(PrivDir, "verify_plt_info.iplt"),
  647:     compile_all(DataDir, PrivDir),
  648:     ErlangModule = erlang_module(),
  649:     Opts = [{init_plt, [Plt]}, {warning_files, ToPath([fix, got_fixed])}],
  650:     [] = run_dialyzer(incremental, [ErlangModule | ToPath([fix, got_fixed])], Opts),
  651:     break_module(DataDir, PrivDir),
  652:     [_Error1, _Error2] = run_dialyzer(incremental, [ErlangModule | ToPath([fix, got_fixed])], Opts),
  653:     fix_module(DataDir, PrivDir),
  654:     [] = run_dialyzer(incremental, [ErlangModule | ToPath([fix, got_fixed])], Opts).
  655: 
  656: break_module(DataDir, PrivDir) ->
  657:     compile:file(filename:join(DataDir, "fix.erl"),
  658:                  [{outdir, PrivDir},
  659:                   debug_info,
  660:                   {d, error, true}]).
  661: 
  662: fix_module(DataDir, PrivDir) ->
  663:     compile:file(filename:join(DataDir, "fix.erl"),
  664:                  [{outdir, PrivDir},
  665:                   debug_info]).
  666: 
  667: %% There is one warning per module which will be reported when that module is re-analyzed
  668: %% We expect a module to be re-analyzed when it has changed, or when one of its transitive
  669: %% dependencies have changed.
  670: expected_modules_reanalyzed_incremental(ChangedMods) ->
  671:     DependsOn = fun depends_on/1,
  672:     ordsets:from_list([Mod || C <- ChangedMods,
  673:                               Mod <- [C|depends_on_transitively(C, DependsOn)]]).
  674: 
  675: change_module(DataDir, PrivDir, Mod) ->
  676:     compile:file(filename:join(DataDir, atom_to_list(Mod)++".erl"),
  677:         [{outdir, PrivDir}, debug_info, {d, Mod, erlang:monotonic_time()}]).
  678: 
  679: delete_module_beam_file(PrivDir, Mod) ->
  680:     ModuleBeamPath = PrivDir ++ atom_to_list(Mod) ++ ".beam",
  681:     ok = file:delete(ModuleBeamPath).
  682: 
  683: %% Common utility functions
  684: 
  685: replace_location(Warnings) ->
  686:     [{Type, loc, Warning} || {Type, _Loc, Warning} <- Warnings].
  687: 
  688: warning_for_module(Mod) -> {warn_contract_types,loc,
  689:                        {invalid_contract,
  690:                            [Mod,wrong,1,{[1],true},"(float()) -> float()","(integer()) -> integer()"]}}.
  691: 
  692: compile_all(DataDir, PrivDir) ->
  693:     [{ok, _} = compile:file(File, [{outdir, PrivDir}, debug_info]) || File <- filelib:wildcard(DataDir ++ "*.erl")].
  694: 
  695: %% This describes the dependencies between modules m1->m6 in
  696: %% incremental_SUITE_data/ If you change thos deps update here.
  697: %% Don't add cycles (yet) or at least without changing depends on transitively
  698: depends_on(m1) -> [];
  699: depends_on(m2) -> [m1];
  700: depends_on(m3) -> [];
  701: depends_on(m4) -> [m2,m3];
  702: depends_on(m5) -> [m4];
  703: depends_on(m6) -> [m4].
  704: 
  705: depends_on(X, IsInPlt) ->
  706:     [D || D <- depends_on(X), IsInPlt(D)].
  707: 
  708: depends_on_transitively(M, DependsOn) ->
  709:     Val = DependsOn(M),
  710:     Val ++ [Dep || V <- Val, Dep <- [V|depends_on_transitively(V, DependsOn)]].
  711: 
  712: all_subsets([X|Rest]) ->
  713:     [Res || SubSet <- all_subsets(Rest), Res <- [[X|SubSet], SubSet]];
  714: all_subsets([]) -> [[]].
  715: 
  716: all_mods() -> [m1,m2,m3,m4,m5,m6].
  717: 
  718: run_dialyzer(Analysis, Files, Opts) ->
  719:     dialyzer:run([{analysis_type, Analysis},
  720:       {files, Files},
  721:       {from, byte_code},
  722:       {warnings, [no_unknown]}|
  723:       Opts]).
  724: 
  725: run_dialyzer_for_modules_analyzed(Analysis, Files, Opts) ->
  726:     dialyzer:run_report_modules_analyzed([{analysis_type, Analysis},
  727: 		  {files, Files},
  728: 		  {from, byte_code}|
  729: 		  Opts]).
  730: 
  731: default_apps_config_xdg(Config) ->
  732:     TestHome = filename:join(?config(priv_dir, Config), ?FUNCTION_NAME),
  733: 
  734:     %% We change the $HOME of the emulator to run this test
  735:     HomeEnv =
  736:         case os:type() of
  737:             {win32, _} ->
  738:                 [Drive | Path] = filename:split(TestHome),
  739:                 [{"APPDATA", filename:join(TestHome, "AppData")},
  740:                  {"HOMEDRIVE", Drive},
  741:                  {"HOMEPATH", filename:join(Path)}];
  742:             _ ->
  743:                 [{"HOME", TestHome}]
  744:         end,
  745: 
  746:     io:format("~p~n", [HomeEnv]),
  747: 
  748:     PrivDir = ?config(priv_dir, Config),
  749:     PltFile = filename:join(PrivDir, atom_to_list(?FUNCTION_NAME) ++ ".iplt"),
  750: 
  751:     {ok, Peer, Node} = ?CT_PEER(#{ env => HomeEnv }),
  752: 
  753:     erpc:call(
  754:       Node,
  755:       fun() ->
  756:               %% Find out the path of the config file
  757:               HomeConfigFilename =
  758:                   filename:join(filename:basedir(user_config, "erlang"),
  759:                                 "dialyzer.config"),
  760:               io:format("~ts\n", [HomeConfigFilename]),
  761:               ok = filelib:ensure_dir(HomeConfigFilename),
  762: 
  763:               %% Write configuration file
  764:               HomeConfig =
  765:                   {incremental, {default_apps, [stdlib, kernel, erts,
  766:                                                 compiler, mnesia, ftp]}},
  767:               ok = file:write_file(HomeConfigFilename,
  768:                                    io_lib:format("~p.~n", [HomeConfig])),
  769: 
  770:               %% Run dialyzer and check result
  771:               _ = dialyzer:run([{analysis_type, incremental},
  772:                                 {init_plt,PltFile},
  773:                                 {output_plt, PltFile}]),
  774:               {ok, {incremental, [{modules, Modules}]}} = dialyzer:plt_info(PltFile),
  775: 
  776:               ExpectedModules = [gb_sets, erlang, compile, mnesia, ftp],
  777: 
  778:               %% Assert PLT info contains modules from the apps given in the config
  779:               ?assertMatch([], ordsets:subtract(
  780:                                  ordsets:from_list(ExpectedModules),
  781:                                  ordsets:from_list(Modules)))
  782:       end),
  783: 
  784:     peer:stop(Peer).
  785: 
  786: 
  787: default_apps_config_env_var(Config) ->
  788:     TestDir = filename:join(?config(priv_dir, Config), ?FUNCTION_NAME),
  789: 
  790:     ConfigFilename =
  791:       filename:join(
  792:        [TestDir, "some_custom_location", "dialyzer.config"]),
  793:     ok = filelib:ensure_dir(ConfigFilename),
  794: 
  795:     Env = [{"DIALYZER_CONFIG", ConfigFilename}],
  796: 
  797:     DialyzerConfig =
  798:       {incremental, {default_apps, [stdlib, kernel, erts, compiler, mnesia, ftp]}},
  799: 
  800:     ok = file:write_file(ConfigFilename, io_lib:format("~p.~n", [DialyzerConfig])),
  801: 
  802:     PrivDir = ?config(priv_dir, Config),
  803:     PltFile = filename:join(PrivDir, atom_to_list(?FUNCTION_NAME) ++ ".iplt"),
  804: 
  805:     {ok, Peer, Node} = ?CT_PEER(#{ env => Env }),
  806: 
  807:     erpc:call(
  808:       Node,
  809:       fun() ->
  810:         _ = dialyzer:run([{analysis_type, incremental},
  811:                           {init_plt,PltFile},
  812:                           {output_plt, PltFile}]),
  813:         {ok, {incremental, [{modules, Modules}]}} = dialyzer:plt_info(PltFile),
  814: 
  815:         ExpectedModules = [gb_sets, erlang, compile, mnesia, ftp],
  816: 
  817:         % Assert PLT info contains modules from the apps given in the config
  818:         ?assertMatch([], sets:to_list(sets:subtract(
  819:                            sets:from_list(ExpectedModules),
  820:                            sets:from_list(Modules))))
  821:       end),
  822: 
  823:     peer:stop(Peer).
  824: 
  825: default_apps_config_env_var_prioritised_over_xdg(Config) ->
  826:     TestHome = filename:join(?config(priv_dir, Config), ?FUNCTION_NAME),
  827: 
  828:     ConfigSubDirs =
  829:         case os:type() of
  830:             {unix, darwin} ->
  831:                 ["Library","Application Support"];
  832:             {win32, _} ->
  833:                 [];
  834:             _ ->
  835:                 [".config"]
  836:         end,
  837: 
  838:     HomeConfigFilename =
  839:       filename:join([TestHome] ++ ConfigSubDirs ++ ["erlang", "dialyzer.config"]),
  840:     ok = filelib:ensure_dir(HomeConfigFilename),
  841: 
  842:     HomeConfig =
  843:       {incremental, {default_apps, [stdlib, kernel, erts]}},
  844: 
  845:     ok = file:write_file(HomeConfigFilename, io_lib:format("~p.~n", [HomeConfig])),
  846: 
  847:     ConfigFilename =
  848:       filename:join(
  849:        [TestHome, "some_custom_location", "dialyzer.config"]),
  850:     ok = filelib:ensure_dir(ConfigFilename),
  851: 
  852: 
  853:     %% We change the $HOME of the emulator to run this test
  854:     HomeEnv = case os:type() of
  855:                   {win32, _} ->
  856:                       [Drive | Path] = filename:split(TestHome),
  857:                       [{"APPDATA", filename:join(TestHome,"AppData")},
  858:                        {"HOMEDRIVE", Drive}, {"HOMEPATH", Path}];
  859:                   _ ->
  860:                       [{"HOME", TestHome}]
  861:               end,
  862: 
  863:     Env = HomeEnv ++ [{"DIALYZER_CONFIG", ConfigFilename}],
  864: 
  865:     EnvVarConfig =
  866:       {incremental, {default_apps, [compiler, mnesia, ftp]}},
  867: 
  868:     ok = file:write_file(ConfigFilename, io_lib:format("~p.~n", [EnvVarConfig])),
  869: 
  870:     PrivDir = ?config(priv_dir, Config),
  871:     PltFile = filename:join(PrivDir, atom_to_list(?FUNCTION_NAME) ++ ".iplt"),
  872: 
  873:     {ok, Peer, Node} = ?CT_PEER(#{ env => Env }),
  874: 
  875:     erpc:call(
  876:       Node,
  877:       fun() ->
  878:         _ = dialyzer:run([{analysis_type, incremental},
  879:                           {init_plt,PltFile},
  880:                           {output_plt, PltFile}]),
  881:         {ok, {incremental, [{modules, Modules}]}} = dialyzer:plt_info(PltFile),
  882: 
  883:         ExpectedModules = [compile, mnesia, ftp],
  884:         UnexpectedModules = [gb_sets],
  885: 
  886:         % Assert PLT info contains modules from the apps given in the env var config
  887:         ?assertMatch([], sets:to_list(sets:subtract(
  888:                            sets:from_list(ExpectedModules),
  889:                            sets:from_list(Modules)))),
  890: 
  891:         % Assert PLT info does not contain modules from the apps given in the xdg config
  892:         ?assertMatch([], sets:to_list(sets:intersection(
  893:                            sets:from_list(UnexpectedModules),
  894:                            sets:from_list(Modules))))
  895:       end),
  896: 
  897:     peer:stop(Peer).
  898: 
  899: legal_warnings_config_xdg(Config) ->
  900:     TestHome = filename:join(?config(priv_dir, Config), ?FUNCTION_NAME),
  901: 
  902:     %% We change the $HOME of the emulator to run this test
  903:     HomeEnv =
  904:         case os:type() of
  905:             {win32, _} ->
  906:                 [Drive | Path] = filename:split(TestHome),
  907:                 [{"APPDATA", filename:join(TestHome, "AppData")},
  908:                  {"HOMEDRIVE", Drive},
  909:                  {"HOMEPATH", filename:join(Path)}];
  910:             _ ->
  911:                 [{"HOME", TestHome}]
  912:         end,
  913: 
  914:     io:format("~p~n", [HomeEnv]),
  915: 
  916:     {ok, Peer, Node} = ?CT_PEER(#{ env => HomeEnv }),
  917: 
  918:     SrcWithImproperList = <<"
  919:       -module(my_improper_list_module).
  920:       -export([g/0]).
  921: 
  922:       g() -> [a|b]. % Improper list: Last element is not the empty list
  923:       ">>,
  924: 
  925:     {ok, BeamFileWithImproperList} =
  926:       compile(Config, SrcWithImproperList, my_improper_list_module, []),
  927: 
  928:     AppsConfig =
  929:         {incremental, {default_apps, [stdlib, kernel, erts, compiler, mnesia, ftp]}},
  930: 
  931:     erpc:call(
  932:       Node,
  933:       fun() ->
  934:           %% Find out the path of the config file
  935:           HomeConfigFilename =
  936:               filename:join(filename:basedir(user_config, "erlang"),
  937:                             "dialyzer.config"),
  938:           io:format("~ts\n", [HomeConfigFilename]),
  939:           ok = filelib:ensure_dir(HomeConfigFilename),
  940: 
  941:           %% Write configuration file
  942:           WarningsConfig1 =
  943:               {warnings, [no_unknown, no_improper_lists]},
  944:           ok = file:write_file(HomeConfigFilename,
  945:                                io_lib:format("~p.~n~p.~n", [AppsConfig, WarningsConfig1])),
  946:           WarningsWithConfigSet =
  947:             dialyzer:run([{analysis_type, incremental},
  948:                           {files, [BeamFileWithImproperList]},
  949:                           {from, byte_code}]),
  950:           ?assertEqual([], WarningsWithConfigSet),
  951: 
  952:           %% Write alternative configuration file
  953:           WarningsConfig2 =
  954:               {warnings, [no_unknown]},
  955:           ok = file:write_file(HomeConfigFilename,
  956:                                io_lib:format("~p.~n~p.~n", [AppsConfig, WarningsConfig2])),
  957:           WarningsWithoutConfigSet =
  958:             dialyzer:run([{analysis_type, incremental},
  959:                           {files, [BeamFileWithImproperList]},
  960:                           {from, byte_code}]),
  961:           ?assertMatch([{warn_non_proper_list, _Loc, _Msg}], WarningsWithoutConfigSet)
  962:       end),
  963: 
  964:     peer:stop(Peer).
  965: 
  966: paths_config_xdg(Config) ->
  967:     TestHome = filename:join(?config(priv_dir, Config), ?FUNCTION_NAME),
  968: 
  969:     %% We change the $HOME of the emulator to run this test
  970:     HomeEnv =
  971:         case os:type() of
  972:             {win32, _} ->
  973:                 [Drive | Path] = filename:split(TestHome),
  974:                 [{"APPDATA", filename:join(TestHome, "AppData")},
  975:                  {"HOMEDRIVE", Drive},
  976:                  {"HOMEPATH", filename:join(Path)}];
  977:             _ ->
  978:                 [{"HOME", TestHome}]
  979:         end,
  980: 
  981:     io:format("~p~n", [HomeEnv]),
  982: 
  983:     ExtraModulesDirOrig =
  984:       filename:join(?config(data_dir, Config), "extra_modules"),
  985:     ExtraModulesDir =
  986:       filename:join(?config(priv_dir, Config), "extra_modules"),
  987:     ok = filelib:ensure_path(ExtraModulesDir),
  988:     ok = filelib:ensure_path(filename:join(ExtraModulesDir,"ebin")),
  989:     ok = filelib:ensure_path(filename:join(ExtraModulesDir,"src")),
  990: 
  991:     {ok, _} =
  992:       file:copy(
  993:         filename:join([ExtraModulesDirOrig, "src", "extra_modules.app.src"]),
  994:         filename:join([ExtraModulesDir, "src", "extra_modules.app.src"])
  995:       ),
  996:     {ok, _} =
  997:       file:copy(
  998:         filename:join([ExtraModulesDirOrig, "src", "extra_module.erl"]),
  999:         filename:join([ExtraModulesDir, "src", "extra_module.erl"])
 1000:       ),
 1001: 
 1002:     {ok, Peer, Node} = ?CT_PEER(#{ env => HomeEnv }),
 1003:     {ok, _} =
 1004:       compile:file(
 1005:         filename:join([ExtraModulesDir,"src","extra_module.erl"]),
 1006:         [{outdir, filename:join([ExtraModulesDir,"ebin"])}, debug_info]
 1007:       ),
 1008: 
 1009:     AppsConfig =
 1010:         {incremental,
 1011:           {default_apps,
 1012:             [stdlib,
 1013:              kernel,
 1014:              erts,
 1015:              extra_modules
 1016:             ]
 1017:           },
 1018:           {default_warning_apps,
 1019:             [extra_modules % Only on path if added explicitly via config below
 1020:             ]
 1021:           }
 1022:         },
 1023: 
 1024:     WarningsConfig =
 1025:         {warnings, [no_unknown]},
 1026: 
 1027:     erpc:call(
 1028:       Node,
 1029:       fun() ->
 1030:           %% Find out the path of the config file
 1031:           HomeConfigFilename =
 1032:               filename:join(filename:basedir(user_config, "erlang"),
 1033:                             "dialyzer.config"),
 1034:           io:format("~ts~n", [HomeConfigFilename]),
 1035:           ok = filelib:ensure_dir(HomeConfigFilename),
 1036: 
 1037:           %% Write configuration file
 1038:           PathConfig = {add_pathsa, [ExtraModulesDir, filename:join(ExtraModulesDir, "ebin"), filename:join(ExtraModulesDir, "src")]},
 1039:           ok =
 1040:             file:write_file(
 1041:               HomeConfigFilename,
 1042:               io_lib:format(
 1043:                 "~p.~n~p.~n~p.~n",
 1044:                 [AppsConfig, WarningsConfig, PathConfig])),
 1045: 
 1046:           {Warnings, ModAnalyzed} =
 1047:             % Will analyse apps from config, including the `extra_modules` app
 1048:             % which contains a Dialyzer error
 1049:             dialyzer:run_report_modules_analyzed([
 1050:                 {analysis_type, incremental},
 1051:                 {from, byte_code}]),
 1052: 
 1053:           % Check we did actually analyze the module
 1054:           ?assert(
 1055:              lists:member(extra_module, ModAnalyzed),
 1056:              lists:flatten(io_lib:format("Looking for 'extra_module' in ~tp~n", [ModAnalyzed]))),
 1057: 
 1058:           % Check we got the warnings we expected from modules
 1059:           % added to the path
 1060:           ?assertMatch(
 1061:              [ {warn_contract_types, {_,_}, {invalid_contract, [extra_module,f,1, {[1],true}, "(atom()) -> string()", "(integer()) -> nonempty_improper_list(integer(),3)"]}},
 1062:                {warn_non_proper_list, {_,_}, {improper_list_constr,["3"]}}
 1063:              ],
 1064:              Warnings)
 1065:       end),
 1066: 
 1067:     peer:stop(Peer).
 1068: 
 1069: multiple_plts_unsupported_in_incremental_mode(Config) ->
 1070:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 1071:     BazPltFile = filename:join(PrivDir, atom_to_list(?FUNCTION_NAME) ++ "-baz.iplt"),
 1072:     QuuxPltFile = filename:join(PrivDir, atom_to_list(?FUNCTION_NAME) ++ "-quux.iplt"),
 1073: 
 1074:     BazSrc = <<"
 1075:       -module(baz).
 1076: 
 1077:       f() -> ok.
 1078:       ">>,
 1079:     QuuxSrc = <<"
 1080:       -module(quux).
 1081: 
 1082:       g() -> undefined.
 1083:       ">>,
 1084: 
 1085:     {ok, BazBeamFile} = compile(Config, BazSrc, baz, []),
 1086:     {ok, QuuxBeamFile} = compile(Config, QuuxSrc, quux, []),
 1087:     _ = run_dialyzer(incremental, [BazBeamFile], [{output_plt, BazPltFile}]),
 1088:     _ = run_dialyzer(incremental, [QuuxBeamFile], [{output_plt, QuuxPltFile}]),
 1089: 
 1090:     ?assertThrow(
 1091:        {dialyzer_error,"Incremental mode does not support multiple PLT files (" ++ _},
 1092:        run_dialyzer(incremental,
 1093:                     [BazBeamFile, QuuxBeamFile],
 1094:                     [{plts, [BazPltFile, QuuxPltFile]}])).
 1095: 
 1096: compile(Config, Prog, Module, CompileOpts) ->
 1097:     Source = lists:concat([Module, ".erl"]),
 1098:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir,Config),
 1099:     Filename = filename:join([PrivDir, Source]),
 1100:     ok = file:write_file(Filename, Prog),
 1101:     Opts = [{outdir, PrivDir}, debug_info | CompileOpts],
 1102:     {ok, Module} = compile:file(Filename, Opts),
 1103:     {ok, filename:join([PrivDir, lists:concat([Module, ".beam"])])}.
 1104: 
 1105: %% https://erlang.org/doc/man/ct.html#capture_get-1 seems to work by redirecting
 1106: %% writes to stdout to be messages to the current pid. Those messages get queued up,
 1107: %% with the intent to read them back later to get stdout.
 1108: %%
 1109: %% At various points, Dialyzer dequeues messages from its worker child processes,
 1110: %% sometimes throwing them away knowing it doesn't need certain results from them.
 1111: %%
 1112: %% Sadly, these two things interact badly and Dialyzer ends up dequeuing (and hence,
 1113: %% deleting) some of what was written to stdout. The solution is to run Dialyzer in
 1114: %% a sub-process, so the messages go to the parent process's mailbox and Dialyzer is
 1115: %% free to do what it wants with its own messages.
 1116: %%
 1117: %% Fundamentally this is an issue with ct:capture_get, since it seems to presume it's
 1118: %% fine to send messages to the test case's pid and they'll never be read by the code
 1119: %% under test!
 1120: run_dialyzer_capture(Analysis, Files, Opts) ->
 1121:     ct:capture_start(),
 1122:     TestCasePid = self(),
 1123:     RunDialyzer = fun() ->
 1124:         Ret = run_dialyzer(Analysis, Files, Opts),
 1125:         TestCasePid ! {dialyzer_done, Ret}
 1126:     end,
 1127:     _DialyzerPid = spawn_link(RunDialyzer),
 1128:     DialyzerRet =
 1129:         receive
 1130:             {dialyzer_done, Ret} -> Ret
 1131:         end,
 1132:     ct:capture_stop(),
 1133:     Stdout = ct:capture_get([]),
 1134:     {DialyzerRet, Stdout}.
